tutorial_intro:
Thank you very much for participating in the study.
The aim of this research is to understand how people solve problems during activities (which, from now on, we will call games).
You will use this computer to interact with another participant (whom we will call the player) in an online chat.

You and the other player will participate in cooperative games and earn points by solving problems correctly.
You and the other player will see identical screens, and the other player will send the final answers to the researcher.

Your mission is to help the other player solve the problems, using the chat to communicate with them.
You will receive instructions on how to use the chat in this tutorial. To do this, follow the instructions that appear on the screen.
start_tutorial: Click the 'Ready!' button to start the tutorial!
tutorial_step1: Welcome to the Online Problem-Solving Chat! In this tutorial, you will learn how to use the chat and its features.
inputmodal_2: This is the text box. Type your message here and press the 'Send' button or the 'Enter' key to send messages to the other player.
inputmodal_3: This is the message history field. All sent and received messages will appear here. You will hear a sound when the other player sends you a message and when your message is sent to the other player.
inputmodal_4: Here you will see the name of the other player.
inputmodal_5: You will be able to track the activity of the other player. A message will inform you when they are typing.
inputmodal_6: This is the game screen. You and the other player will see the same games, which may have different levels of difficulty and include problem-solving activities with various combinations and patterns of numbers, shapes, colors, or letters. Your mission is to solve the problem cooperatively with the other player, using the chat to talk to them.
inputmodal_7: This is the countdown timer. The remaining time you will have to solve the problem will appear here.
inputmodal_8: Here you will see the total points you have accumulated in all the games you have participated in.
inputmodal_9: Here you will see the final answer that the other player will send as the solution to the problem.
tutorial_step10: Now that you know how the chat works, I will show you a sample game. Then, you will practice with some games before starting. This is a computer simulation, so it is not a real player. For now, you just need to watch the example.
tutorial_step13: For this problem, I will type the message: 'The answer is triangle.' I will show you how to send the message.
tutorial_step15: Now I will show another sample game. This is another computer simulation.
tutorial_step17: For this problem, I will type the message: 'I think the answer is 11.' I will show you how to send the message.
tutorial_step19: Now that I have shown you how to write and send messages, it's your turn to practice in a computer simulation before playing with another player. To do this, follow the instructions that will appear on the screen. Click the 'Ready!' button to start.
tutorial_step20_1: Welcome to the Online Problem-Solving Chat!
tutorial_step20_3: Click 'READY!' when you are ready to start the game.
tutorial_step22: For this problem, type the following message: 'green arrow up'.
tutorial_step22_wrong: The typed sentence contains an error: you typed '{{typedMessage}}' instead of 'green arrow up'. Please try again by typing the sentence correctly.
tutorial_step25: Now that you know how the game works and how to send messages, you will start playing with another player. At this moment, the other player is receiving the same instructions from this tutorial. Please wait for the other player to be ready to play with you. This may take 1 to 5 minutes. When the other player is ready, the researcher will let you know and the game will begin.
yes_i_think_you_are_right: Yes, I think you are right!
which_option: Which option are you thinking of?
title: Online Problem-Solving Chat
find_the_solution_to_the_problem: Find the solution to the problem
please_provide_team_answer: Please fill in the "Team Answer" field.
the_user_completed_the_tutorial_successf: The user completed the tutorial successfully.
the_task_mastery_criterion_was_achieved_: The task mastery criterion was achieved on the {{numTries}}th try.
waiting_for_other_player: Waiting for the other player to be ready...
click_ready_when_you_are_ready_to_start_: Click 'READY!' when you are ready to start the game.
thank_you_for_participating: Thank you very much for participating!
please_wait_for_the_researcher: Please wait. The researcher will return to speak with you in a few minutes.
